body:
If you are on Tensorflow, then `Scan(...clear_tf_session=True...)` should address running out of memory after an given number of permutations. 

Yes, we  store the model (serialized as json like) and weights as opposed to storing a model. Then later through various commands, we activate the model as we would after storing it on a disk.

I did som digging and testing

This patch seems to solve/help the problem when using cntk, how it plays with other backends I do not know

    diff --git a/talos/scan/scan_round.py b/talos/scan/scan_round.py
    index 2ed56ac..d11f09f 100644
    --- a/talos/scan/scan_round.py
    +++ b/talos/scan/scan_round.py
    @@ -1,4 +1,5 @@
     from time import strftime, time
    +import gc
    
     from keras import backend as K
    
    @@ -70,6 +71,9 @@ def scan_round(self):
         self.saved_models.append(self.keras_model.to_json())
         self.saved_weights.append(self.keras_model.get_weights())
    
    +    del self.keras_model
    +    gc.collect()
    +
         # clear tensorflow sessions (maybe)
         if self.clear_tf_session is True:
             K.clear_session()
Perhaps the current `clear_tf_session` can change its name to 'clear_session' and accepts either None or 'tf', 'theano', and 'cntk' with the corresponding procedures implemented. What do you think?

rename.to: Running out of GPU memory (add clear_session for all backends)

body: Sure, that would be more clear. If that is done I think it is rather important to state this clearly in the documentation but as long as that is done it should be a good solution.
Would just `del self.keras_model` do the job? At that point it seems safe to delete the model for all cases.
I do not know, I will try starting with that configuration and see if it worked tomorrow

The

del self.keras_model

part seems to be enough
I might have said all clear to early, it failed now, much later that earlier failed runs but failed it did. I will try to re-add the gc.collect() and restart and see if that makes it pass
I reran the test with gc.collect() and now it did not crash, so I think that both are nessecary.

Thanks! How much do you know about gc.collect()? 

I know it's brutally effective in addressing memory issues, but is there some possible risk (for example some data changing etc). 

If we are 100% sure there is no risk to system integrity otherwise, I will test `del self.keras_model; gc.collect();` for tensorflow and theano as well and see if there is any memory issue.

I have no experience sadly

From the name of it it sounds very safe but better test than be sorry
I'll do some research on this and ask around to get a better understanding of the risks associated with explicit garbage collection on Python.

issue.title: The option clear_tf_session is confusing when using other backends

repository.name: talos
repository.description: Hyperparameter Optimization for TensorFlow, Keras and PyTorch

issue.body: When reading the code it looks like the clear_tf_session option is in fact clearing the keras session regardless of which backend is used, this is a bit confusing if tensorflow is not the selected backend. Should this be renamed?

issue.title: Unable to use Theano as backend

repository.name: talos
repository.description: Hyperparameter Optimization for TensorFlow, Keras and PyTorch

issue.body:
- [X] I'm up-to-date with the latest release:
    
      pip install -U talos

- [X] I've confirmed that my Keras model works outside of Talos.

The scan_round.py tries to clear the graph session assuming that I am using TensorFlow. Is there a work around for this?

Gist link for the keras model I used- https://gist.github.com/shakkeel1330/8b1ed785dcd0a1356ab59cf6831fc3f1

body:
I have been reading a bit and find no mention of gc.collect being unsafe, what I do find is for exqample the following link whioch explains what it does. https://stackoverflow.com/a/18026125/1666637

Should I make a pull request for this to be included, I have been running this scince I filed the bug with no ill effects

Yes, it seems that the only material concern with gc.collect() is performance, which should not be an issue in our case as I'm assuming gc.collect() would not take more than a fraction of the second.

I think we should use the opportunity to make sure that Talos supports all three backends overall. I think there should be no problem with that. Do I understand correct that you are using CNTK?

Yes, no performance hit has been noticable when I have used it.

Yes I'm using CNTK

issue.title: added cleanup of keras model to avoid a GPY memmory related crash in CNTK (fixes #206)

repository.name: talos
repository.description: Hyperparameter Optimization for TensorFlow, Keras and PyTorch

body:
This is done, so closing here. I recommend moving to v.0.6 for this and many other important improvements. 

`pip install git+https://github.com/autonomio/talos@daily-dev`
